item.title: More models, more features: what's new in 'parameters' 0.2.0
item.description: The easystats project continues to grow, expanding its capabilities and features, and the parameters package 0.2.0 update is now on CRAN. The primary goal of this package is to provide utilities for processing the parameters of various statistical models. It is useful for end-users as well as developers, as it is a lightweight and open-developed package. The main function, model_parameters(), can be seen as an alternative to broom::tidy(). However, the package also include many more useful features, some of which are described in our improved documentation:

item.title: parameters: a powerful and lightweight alternative to broom to describe your models' coefficients
item.description: Okay, “an alternative to broom” might be a bit of an overstatement (at least for now…) But the parameters package, finally on CRAN, already has some cool features! parameters We have recently decided to collaborate around the easystats project, a set of packages designed to make your life easier. This project encompasses several packages, devoted for instance to model internal access, Bayesian analysis, as well as indices of model performance and quality.
